byline.original: By MICHAEL MOSS and ANDREW MARTIN

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama vowed on Thursday that there would be real improvements in the health care system ''this time around,'' and for the moment, at least, he enjoyed bipartisan agreement that something has to be done. ''I just want to figure out what works,'' the president said at the White House at the end of a day-long meeting on health care that brought together a diverse group of people, in and out of government, who have to deal with the ever-spiraling increase in care costs.

headline.main: Obama Vows to End Stalemate on Health Care

docs.snippet: President Obama vowed on Thursday that there would be real improvements in the health care system ''this time around,'' and for the moment, at least, he enjoyed bipartisan agreement that something has to be done.     ''I just want to figure out what...

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and DAVID STOUT

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 4:09 p.m. The wrap up session: President Obama entered the room with Senator Edward M. Kennedy, who said said he looked forward to being a "foot soldier" in the push for health care reform and "this time we will not fail."
docs.abstract: "Those who seek to block any reform at any cost will not prevail this time around," President Obama said in opening a White House conference, where he promised to reduce health costs and expand coverage.
docs.snippet: "Those who seek to block any reform at any cost will not prevail this time around," President Obama said in opening a White House conference, where he promised to reduce health costs and expand coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Throughout the Capitol, from the vaulted Assembly chamber to the first-floor cubicles of the Budget Division, officials are frantically cutting budgets, trimming head counts and freezing salaries to deal with the worst fiscal crisis in decades.

headline.main: In Albany, a Scramble to Spend Stimulus Funds

docs.lead_paragraph: As Hillary Rodham Clinton keeps her distance from President Obama’s health care plan, the White House is grappling with the cloud that still lingers over her failed policy from the 1990s.
